You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show the Effective Account Selector

Support buyers who can browse and purchase on behalf of accounts other than their own. When you enable effective accounts, provide an intuitive user experience directly on the storefront for a buyer to easily switch between accounts. Selecting a different account shows that account's entitled products, entitled prices, and other account information.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 or classic
Pages	All pages
Page layouts	Any page layout
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can configure the Effective Account Selector to appear as either of the following user experience components:

A label in the header
A separate widget on a storefront page
NOTE When the selector is in the header, the selector appears on every page. However, on some pages—such as the Shopping Cart page or Checkout page—the selector is read-only, and only shows the selected effective account. The buyer can't select a different effective account from these pages. When the selector is a widget, the selector can appear only on the following pages by default:
Home page
Product List page
Product Detail page
My Account page

Clicking the label in the header or clicking the Change button in the widget launches a window, where the buyer can select a different effective account.

NOTE The effective accounts listed in the window sort by each account record's Created Date. To customize this order, create subscriber code that extends the default Effective Account Selector.

To enable the Effective Account Selector for your storefront, update your storefront configuration settings.

First, enable effective accounts and set up your effective account strategy. For help with setting up effective accounts for use with the Effective Account Selector, see Allow a Buyer to Purchase for Multiple Effective Accounts.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Effective Account (3).
Find the Enabled configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Effective Account
Configuration	Enabled
Page	all
Value	TRUE

When the selector is a widget, you can show the widget on some supported pages, but not all of them, by creating multiple configurations. For example, maybe you want to show the selector widget on every supported page except the My Account page. Create one Enabled configuration where Page is all and Value is TRUE, and create a second Enabled configuration where Page is MA and Value is FALSE.

Find the Display Mode configuration (6), and find its value (7).
TIP
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Effective Account
Configuration	Display Mode
Page	all
Value	header or widget
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
NOTE
When a buyer selects an effective account, B2B Commerce for Visualforce sets the apex__effacc browser cookie.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, the LSKey[c]effacc cookie is also set when a buyer browses an Experience Builder site that shows B2B Commerce content.
Other optional configurations are available for the selector, depending on how you want to fine-tune the buyer's experience when using an effective account.
Include the Buyer's Assigned Account in the Effective Account Selector
Control whether the account assigned to a buyer appears in the Effective Account Selector along with the available effective accounts. Maybe you only want the buyer to purchase on behalf of other accounts, and never purchase on behalf of their own account. Maybe you only want a buyer to purchase on behalf of their own account if they can't access any other effective accounts.
Specify the Source for Shipping Addresses in the Effective Account Selector
Choose which record type provides the shipping addresses that appear for each effective account.
SEE ALSO

title: Show the Effective Account Selector in Salesforce
